name: Avoid Classes with High Depth of Inheritance Tree (PHP)
description: This rule searches for all Classes with High Depth of Inheritance Tree
output:
This report lists all the Classes with High Depth of Inheritance Tree.

This QR provides the following information:
Class full name.
rationale:
Changing a class requires prior understanding, which, in turn, is
more complicated for classes with many methods. Classes that are deep
down in hierarchy potentially inherit many methods. Moreover, the definitions of inherited methods are not local to the class making it even harder to understand.

Complete testing requires coverage of all execution paths. The number of possible execution paths of class increases
with the number of methods and their control flow complexity.Due to late binding, base methods need to be tested again in the sub type context. This makes it potentially harder to test.

Technical or framework classes which are evolving and will not be changed often should not be concerned by this rule.
remediation: Review the architecture of the application to reduce the depth of the inheritence Tree.
